The food is AMAZING! The "bacon clothes line with apple sauce", the chicken, the croquettes, the pork and the tuna are out of this world!! Special shout out to Natalia who served our food and was amazing with everything we had asked for! We are back for the second time in the space of two days :)  The prices are really good and I will be recommending this place to anyone I know.

Lovely restaurant and very friendly staff bilingual with English menus if you want that. I was brave , a little, and tried the moderate sized steakburger. You choose your meat, beef or ox and the size (moderate is 250 grams or 1/2 pound) but I thought I was hungry so ordered the baked potato with it. It came with 3 small sized potatoes and still was more than I could eat. Cooked very well, presentation was excellent and the recommend rare or medium which is the best for any bit of beef. I loved it and will be back. Highly recommended.

title_review: Nice for combatting the culture shock!
review_preview: Audrey and our waiter were super awesome and kind! My boyfriend doesn’t speak really any Spanish, and after traveling a few days being the only person able to understand anything, we were both ready to have an easy dinner without me having to save him...
review_full: Audrey and our waiter were super awesome and kind! My boyfriend doesn’t speak really any Spanish, and after traveling a few days being the only person able to understand anything, we were both ready to have an easy dinner without me having to save him from eating something he’d regret! Restaurant had English menus, American food, and great service! Definitely would recommend to anyone who may be having difficulty finding food that works for everyone and also may need a little bit of home to avoid the culture shock of lots of ham, and sea food! You can still get an ox burger if you’re wanting something a little different!

review_preview: It's very rare (no pun intended) to find a burger restaurant that asks how you would like your burger cooked. The selection was amazing but I went for the Jack burger and crispy chicken starter, both of which were delicious and very generous portions.Service...
review_full: It's very rare (no pun intended) to find a burger restaurant that asks how you would like your burger cooked. The selection was amazing but I went for the Jack burger and crispy chicken starter, both of which were delicious and very generous portions. Service was excellent and attentive with suitably regular check ups to make sure I had everything I needed. Aitor who served me was very friendly and offered to talk me through the menu if needed and even spotted at one point that I had no napkin and hands covered in delicious burger juice, so brought me one over without asking. I would strongly recommend for anyone visiting Madrid and I'll definitely be going back next time I'm here.

title_review: the worst dinner we ever had - a total cock-up
review_preview: It started with the order, that was taken after more than 20 minutes.After another 25 minutes 2 out of the 4 ordered main courses were served, but were cold. The ordered starter never arrived at our table.After complaining, the cold steak and potatoes...
review_full: It started with the order, that was taken after more than 20 minutes. After another 25 minutes 2 out of the 4 ordered main courses were served, but were cold.  The ordered starter never arrived at our table. After complaining, the cold steak and potatoes were returned to the kitchen and did not come back again. The two missing plates came after another half hour. When we asked about the steak that was returned cold to the kitchen, the waitress brought back a ‘burned’ piece of meet.... We called for the manager, who as the waitress, spoke only some basic words of english, and did not understand the point of our complaints and frustration. Finally we gave it up. Finished the two plates of rips, that were ok and asked for the bill. In the end we paid for the wine and 3 main courses. The water, starter, and 4th plate were for free ! Conclusion: The 2 plate of rips were good, the burger was bearly warm, but still ok, the sirlon steak was first cold and then ‘burned’ - a real nightmare. The waitress cocked it all up with the order and service and did not even try to fix it. The manager wanted to solve the situation by offering more food for free and it took him until we left the restaurant to apologize for the mess. I will definitely not go back to this place and I hope that general management from ‘Steakburger’ get involved to train their staff properly.

review_preview: Yes we were intrigued by the fact that it was among the top ten of the madrileni restaurants and so we decided to visit. The waiters were really utterly helpful and friendly and the whole atmosphere was very cozying. If you arrive around nine in...
review_full: Yes we were intrigued by the fact that it was among the top ten of the madrileni restaurants and so we decided to visit. The waiters were really utterly helpful and friendly and the whole atmosphere was very cozying. If you arrive around nine in the evening be prepared for a slight waiting list but you will be seated eventually within 10-15 minutes. First of all remember ro get half portions of whatever you want to try. You will be amazed of how big are rhe half portions. Do try the huevos rotos - eggs with chips and crunchy bacon, the ropa vieja - meat stew slightly flavored with cumin accompanied with chips, the gampas al ajilo - spiced and garlicky prawns and the solomillo al muscatel - pork with sausage and wine sauce. The bacalao with the goat cheese was a bit more fragrant of the goat that i wished so unless you are a "chèvre" lover you can skip this dish. The Napolitano tiramisu is also a must try. Pricewise is very affordable. Definitely recommended for dinner while in Madrid.

title_review: Tapas for tourists but delicious nonetheless!
review_preview: Ate here before in 2016 on a Tapas Tour. Have lived in Spain and eaten tapas all over the country. Although made for the tourist trade, these offerings are really delicious and good quality. The croquetas among the best you'll get. Many of the tapas...
review_full: Ate here before in 2016 on a Tapas Tour. Have lived in Spain and eaten tapas all over the country. Although made for the tourist trade, these offerings are really delicious and good quality. The croquetas among the best you'll get. Many of the tapas are new twists on standard menu items. Order a tinto de verano, not the touristy sangria. We went early, like 4-5pm, as I'm sure it's packed later in the evening. Worth a try.

The prices were quite normal for tapas but I didn't really get full so I had to order a lot and it turned out to be quite pricey. Fortunately it was worth it. I will definitely be back!

title_review: Good for a quick bite or a long meal

The service was really friendly and fun, and the food absolutely amazing. We were with two people and we had one drink each and 4 half rations (all dishes can be had in half portions which makes it fun to share) for a total of €23! So it was not only delicious and accommodating, but also easy on the wallet. Definitely try the Ropa Vieja, it's one of the best stews I ever had!

If you're looking for a solid dinner and fun atmosphere - check this place out!

I tried six different dishes and not a single one was interesting, tasty or good. Some of the dishes were particularly awful (I have not ever tried worst "croquetas" in my life). The service was as bad as the food. There was a perfect lack of coordination among them, they would ask the same thing several times or they would not ask at all. Clumsy and amateurish. Sometimes an awful, loud sound noise came out of the music speakers and a guy would just say sorry but didn't correct the problem. The place is located in one of the most tourist streets in Madrid and you really had the feeling that you were in a tourist trap. There are 1000 better restaurants in Madrid. Avoid this one.

review_preview: It was our last night in Madrid, and we wanted to pick a decent restaurant.  So again, we relied on Trip Advisor and picked out this place, which was walking distance from our hotel.  We were greeted and seated quickly, and Johnny our server quickly...
review_full: It was our last night in Madrid, and we wanted to pick a decent restaurant. So again, we relied on Trip Advisor and picked out this place, which was walking distance from our hotel. We were greeted and seated quickly, and Johnny our server quickly introduced himself. He was extremely friendly and helpful in recommending a few dishes. He created some conversations, which gave it a personal touch. We had the grilled tapas squid, tapas garlic shrimp, and pulled sirloin. I've never had squid this tender before, it was amazing! The sirloin I was expecting a steak, but was shredded and nonetheless very delicious. The decor was stylish, and lighting help create a very enjoyable atmosphere. Johnny asked us about our meal, and told us a little about the restaurant and the chef. He showed enthusiasm and actually cared about his clients. The establishment is lucky to have an employee like Johnny, he brought the whole experience a level up. We are grateful to have found this place on our last night and enjoyed the experience immensely.

review_preview: After a long day at the Reigna Sofia and the Prado, we took a cab to Calle de Alvarez in search of Inclan Brutal Bar! We were welcomed at the door by Helena who told us that the restaurant was full (and it was barely...
review_full: After a long day at the Reigna Sofia and the Prado, we took a cab to Calle de Alvarez in search of Inclan Brutal Bar! We were welcomed at the door by Helena who told us that the restaurant was full (and it was barely 8.30) but there were seats for us at the bar, which was great as we could see the cocktails being expertly mixed and the buzz in the kitchen where everyone was giving it 110%! Great atmosphere and great service from Guillermo who guided us through the not so huge, but really inviting Menu. We chose Beetroot Gaspacho, a beet Hummus with crispy pitta bread and spicy Potato Wedges dressed with a deliciously spicy mayo, which was enough for my wife - but I went on to order the Iberico Ribs served with small new potatoes cooked in the oven with a coriander sauce. Best ribs ever! Hugely meaty, marvellously tender, the thick glaze and the unusual coriander side were absolutely perfect. A few minutes away from the Plaza Mayor, seek it out. We made it there on our last night there - so no chance of returning (this time around)! we had a beer and two glasses of Rioja all for less than 40 euros! Beat that!!

review_preview: My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant after revisited the Reina Sofia and were very impressed with the food. The service was slow but the servers were running around like crazy trying to keep up with everything- it may have been because of the...
review_full: My husband and I stumbled upon this restaurant after revisited the Reina Sofia and were very impressed with the food. The service was slow but the servers were running around like crazy trying to keep up with everything- it may have been because of the time change they got busier earlier than expected. We returned the next day while waiting for our train and the servers recognized us and gave us a very warm welcome. I highly recommend the Risotto de Boletus, the risotto was perfectly cooked, the Gambones with garlic, which comes out bubbling hot, and the Chipirones a la plancha- the best squid we have had yet while in Spain! And don't forget the sangria!

review_preview: Came across here by chance as my partner and I are a sucker for a steakhouse! We were so in love we came again the following day!!People are super kind and welcoming, speak brilliant English too!First visit we had nachos to share (Huge...
review_full: Came across here by chance as my partner and I are a sucker for a steakhouse! We were so in love we came again the following day!! People are super kind and welcoming, speak brilliant English too! First visit we had nachos to share (Huge but soooo tasty!) both had burgers for our main, I had moderate and my partner had daring! I had never seen such a massive burger! But it was all cooked fresh and tasted incredible. Then managed to squeeze in a ice burger each for pudding. (Two cookies with ice cream inbetween!) we had that with two large drinks, jack Daniels and coke and a daiquiri. We couldn’t believe when the bill only came to €47!! Our drink were €16 of that!! Madness. Second visit I had crispy chicken burger, again perfect. Partner has ribs and they were gorgeous.  Such good food for such a brilliant price. Quick service also! Daiquiris are soooo good. Defo have one if going here!  Don’t think twice, you have to eat here if you like a steakhouse!! (There are about 3 in a couple mile radius, but this one looked the best atmosphere)

The food was lovely and tasty, good sized raciones and the service from the staff was great. We tried a little Spanish and they seemed to appreciate this and put us out of our misery by communicating in English. Decent value and a nice simple setting. It was so good we returned on our second night for dessert. The chocolate cake was delicious! Out of this world! The nice strong cocktails were also a welcome distraction.

review_preview: We decided to try the food here after reading the good reviews. We stopped by for lunch, and we had such a good experience here that we made an on-the-spot reservation for dinner for the very next day!The squid ink paella and the veal...
review_full: We decided to try the food here after reading the good reviews. We stopped by for lunch, and we had such a good experience here that we made an on-the-spot reservation for dinner for the very next day! The squid ink paella and the veal bavette in particular were simply outstanding! Best paella we had throughout our three-week Spain visit, and we would recommend anyone in the area to give it a try. We had ordered the veal based on the simple judgement of every-table-was-eating-it, and thinking back, we really should have ordered two serves! During our dinner we had Sara attend to us, and she was cheerful, helpful and responsive. She admitted to have only started working here for a couple of days, but you wouldn't be able to tell!

review_full: This place left me with such an amazing feeling! The servers were so sweet and spoke English. The food was quite a good price for what me and my party had. The water was surprisingly free (since most places in Spain it does cost). The food was delicious and left me craving more. Will definitely be coming again since it is open for brunch all day. There is however no reservation therefore important to come around 10-10:30 in the morning like I did. By around 11-12, the waiting area was full. Loved the decoration and the fact that one payed later at the bar on the way out. Thanks for a nice start to the day:) BTW the eggs and bacon pancakes were to die for! Just ask for extra maple syrup if you have a sweet tooth like me!

He forgot to tell the waitress/kitchen and we had to get up again to order. Nobody apologized at all for the bad service, they didn't seem to care about us, what a shame. review_preview: What a fantastic experience!  Setting is very, very nice, food was excellent, service was prompt and polite, and prices were reasonable.  This contemporary spot is owned by the same people that operate Rosi La Roca (equally excellent but with different vibe).We ate one night...

This contemporary spot is owned by the same people that operate Rosi La Roca (equally excellent but with different vibe). We ate one night (without reservations) at the bar by the front window. On the 2nd night, we reserved and had a beautiful table at the back plate glass wall that looks onto a very pleasant garden setting. Julia and Nico took care of us on our 2nd night and gave unparalleled attention and service. During our 2 visits, we had tapas or supertapas of gazpacho, hummus, anchovies (seared at the table with a torch), tropical salad, a cheese dish called “it’s not a tomato” (because it looks like a tomato), pollo gamberrro, trampantojo risotto, and cheesecake. All were excellent but the risotto and cheesecake were the best we’ve ever had. Quantities were more than enough for the 2 of us. The presentation and quality of the items rivals any of the top-notch restaurants we’ve visited around the world. We wish we had found them sooner on our trip so we could have gone more than twice!

title_review: Possibly the Best Restaurant In Madrid. Amazing Food and Trendy Modern Scene.
review_preview: Inclan Brutal bar came as a recommendation from the wonderful staff at the OnlyYou Atocha. We loved it so much we went twice; on our first and last nights in Spain. The tapas were creative and inventive. They were filling without being overwhelming or breaking...
review_full: Inclan Brutal bar came as a recommendation from the wonderful staff at the OnlyYou Atocha. We loved it so much we went twice; on our first and last nights in Spain. The tapas were creative and inventive. They were filling without being overwhelming or breaking the bank. Coming from Gran Vía it was a little difficult to find at first. They were gracious when we were a little late and honored our reservation anyway. The staff was friendly, helpful, accommodating.   In terms of drinks, on our first visit we ordered a pitcher of the red sangria (basically juice) which I ordered because everyone else seemed to be drinking it. We did not catch a buzz but this seems to be the case most times we ordered Sangria in Spain. Then towards the end of the meal my sister had an egg white cocktail with lavender in it, in a clear glass that sat on top of crushed up brownies. It was amazing because the drink was delicious and the brownie bites were the perfect sweet way to end the meal.   To eat, we had the special which was squid stuffed with duck meat, the beet gazpacho (which was thick and tasty) and the ribs.  On our last night in Madrid we couldn’t get into their sister restaurant, Rosa Di La Loca, so we came back. Since they couldn’t seat us on time, they gave us complimentary beer before and throughout our meal. We ordered the hummus and tuna tataki. The tuna tataki was fresh and had as many pieces as a main course. It came in a boat with steam coming out of it like a cloud. The hummus was delicious and was a bright green St. Patrick’s day color, the coolest hummus I’d ever seen and it was delicious as well.  The ambiance is minimal but chic. Wood panels line the restaurant. The art is funky too and cohesive around the restaurant and on the menu. The bathroom is "co ed" but two stalls. The dark floral wallpaper is moody and looks very cool in pictures. They have hanging plants in the bathroom as well, the perfect place to take a mirror selfie.  I would 100% recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a cool, trendy, yummy place to eat in Madrid!

title_review: Must try Squid Salad and Paella
review_preview: After walking into 2 restaurants that had over an hour wait on a Friday night, we stumbled onto this restaurant. We were not disappointed! Start of we were drawn in by the huge sangria glass for less than 5 euros. It was filled with fruits...
review_full: After walking into 2 restaurants that had over an hour wait on a Friday night, we stumbled onto this restaurant. We were not disappointed! Start of we were drawn in by the huge sangria glass for less than 5 euros. It was filled with fruits and generous portion. I also had an old fashion that was very strong but wasn’t straight whiskey.  The tartar was loaded with avocado and salmon. The salmon missed a little bit of flavor but none the less delicious. The squid salad is a must have. The squid is cooked perfectly with garlic and the sauce on the side was the perfect combination. Highly recommend! The Paella although my girlfriend said she thought it was very good, I thought it was a little bland. Everyone around us ordered their own paella so it must be worth to at least try. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. The decor had a bit of an indie vibe with posters and pictures. The clientele ranged from college students drinking on a night out to women celebrating 40th birthday. Definitely a lively atmosphere. They also gave us a complimentary birthday cake which was absolutely rich chocolate. So delicious. We were celebrating my girlfriend’s birthday so it was a nice surprise and we didn’t mention that it was her birthday. Will definitely recommend!

review_preview: Brutal Bar is a great little tapas place in the Plaza Santa Ana area.  The selection is neither deep nor wide, but the food is very good and the dry white wine hit the spot.  Though there are 100s or 1000s of tapas places in...
review_full: Brutal Bar is a great little tapas place in the Plaza Santa Ana area. The selection is neither deep nor wide, but the food is very good and the dry white wine hit the spot. Though there are 100s or 1000s of tapas places in Madrid, my wife and I went to Brutal Bar twice in two days and would return again. Ceviche is great as is the chicken. Try the tomato salad with goat cheese and you will not be disappointed. They have a sister place as well called Rosi La Loca. We didn't try that one.

review_preview: “Hands down, that was the best breakfast I’ve EVER had in my life.” - quote from my husband, a breakfast connoisseur and mega eggs enthusiast. My husband’s enthusiasm was sparked by Zenith’s signature Eggs Zenith, which consists of sourdough toast, avocado, chives, hollandaise sauce, jamón...
review_full: “Hands down, that was the best breakfast I’ve EVER had in my life.” - quote from my husband, a breakfast connoisseur and mega eggs enthusiast.  My husband’s enthusiasm was sparked by Zenith’s signature Eggs Zenith, which consists of sourdough toast, avocado, chives, hollandaise sauce, jamón ( he subbed ham) and, the real showstopper - poached breaded eggs.  How does one even go about breading poached eggs?!? It must be magic! (I can barely fry an egg without sealing havoc on my hubby’s most beloved meal). These eggs were poached to perfection, with a thin layer of fried breadcrumbs delicately enveloping the egg white. Delicious! I had customized eggs with toast and an iced coffee. My order had a great yum factor as well. Friendly service, excellent ambiance and amazing food. Five stars!

review_preview: Until I visited this place in the morning, I used to trust TripAdvisor ratings. Now, I’m not sure if they changed their algorithm or I just followed advice of a hundred people who have no idea what good food is. Those of you who read...
review_full: Until I visited this place in the morning, I used to trust TripAdvisor ratings. Now, I’m not sure if they changed their algorithm or I just followed advice of a hundred people who have no idea what good food is. Those of you who read my reviews knows that I rarely give poor ratings or write bad reviews. When I look for a place, I look for the best. I also compare apples with apples. There are 5 Star fast food places and I would never give them 2 stars because they were fast food. No, this place has very mediocre food and very basic service (yes, they DO speak English). The only good thing about this place was it’s very unusual yet very tasty sangria. Shakshuka was just okay and Zenith signature egg dish was .... interesting.... the jamon that came with whatever that was had a quality of a dried out beef in the chefs unsuccessful attempted turn it into a crispy bacon. Espresso was bad. It has ambiance of Starbucks or, and I’m being generous here, Cafe Nero in Fort Point channel in Boston... In short, with over 10 restaurants in Madrid, this one is not near the top. Several places I simply walked in from the street (none of them was Starbucks or MacDonald’s) where at the very least 100 times better.  Hopefully this ratings are joke of hungry American students giving five star reviews in exchange for food. And that’s better than an alternative: my neighbor’s company dropping the ball....

review_full: Had high expectations as trip advisor rated well. Decor on entering did not excite us but some of the best restaurants we have eaten in were not the most stylish . Got seated on a chair that we would probably leave for the garbage man . Waiter arrived , did not speak English but was gracious to ask his friend to take over . Not wanting sangria or beer that they tried to push on us we asked for wine list. We have , we have not. In the end more have nots. Ordered food. My wife had the burrata cheese and I ordered the gazpacho soup . The cheese came along with 2 gazpacho soup . So far great ,but wine was warm and we were advised not to drink for 10 mins. Excellent this far. Then we ordered grilled veal and chicken. Veal , was medium rare as requested but was tough and we ate half of it . The chicken was raw . The waiter seemed shocked when I cut into it and showed him. Would be replaced at no charge. It replaced but we were charged . There was a distinct shortage of menus . Ours was borrowed numerous times as were the condiments. At this stage we were ready to leave. Sorry , normally I agree with trip advisor but I would , could not recommend to my friends .

review_preview: I must say, I'm not easy when it comes to 'outside of Israel' food, but this place was just great. The starters, the mains, the side dishes, the non-ordinary deserts, we loved EVERYTHING. Should be the simplest place - meat and french fries, but if...
review_full: I must say, I'm not easy when it comes to 'outside of Israel' food, but this place was just great. The starters, the mains, the side dishes, the non-ordinary deserts, we loved EVERYTHING. Should be the simplest place - meat and french fries, but if you know your meat you will definitely appreciate this place. The meat was fresh, perfectly cooked, just delicious. And if that's not enough, our waiter was the cutest. Christian handled extremely well all of our requests, (family of 5, lots of requests) he was kind and sweet, and was around every time we needed him. I'm just sad we didn't had a chance to visit there again since it was our last night in Madrid. Great finale though. Will be the first place I'll go next time in Madrid.

review_preview: After passing by and seeing quite a similarity with Ôven (which we loved) just down the road we decided to give it a try.Same design of the menu, website, staff uniforms as the mentioned pizza place, but the outcome a bit different.Theres a...
review_full: After passing by and seeing quite a similarity with Ôven (which we loved) just down the road we decided to give it a try. Same design of the menu, website, staff uniforms as the mentioned pizza place, but the outcome a bit different. Theres a couple of starters such as wings, mozzarella sticks (which are quite nice with their sweet tomato salsa), then selection of burgers (where you can select a size from tiny to a monster big) and then selection of grilled meats with steaks and ribs. The wine/ drink menu points again to the same restaurant group and offers very good wines for very friendly prices. The design of the places is quite well done, again as in the Ôven the toilets are quite impressive with the open sink (not so practical taps but heyy, looks very cool). Seats are comfy and tables big enough to hold your food, however a bit squeezed together. Open bar and open kitchen gives you more to look at as well. The food itself (mozarella sticks already mentioned) is ok at its best.  Our both steaks were more on a chewy side and not much rested so got quite bloodied plates). Unfortunately no peppercorn or bearnaise sauce to go with your meat. Dessert menu is simple and offering good cookie from the oven with ice cream, coffee very tasty. In overall, food ok, service ok (could do with more training), venue nice, but still something was missing. The atmosphere.. not sure if down to music being too low, not busy enough to miss the buzz, but somehow with all the nice design the spirit is not really there. Feel free to disagree..:)

review_preview: My husband and I discovered inClan our last night in Madrid. Located in a bustling area of busy bars and cafes, the exterior resembles a whimsical book shop from Harry Potter, Mary Poppins or Portabello Road, with books lined up and stacked around the entryway....
review_full: My husband and I discovered inClan our last night in Madrid. Located in a bustling area of busy bars and cafes, the exterior resembles a whimsical book shop from Harry Potter, Mary Poppins or Portabello Road, with books lined up and stacked around the entryway. Although it was already full with a queue forming, the hostess was able to seat us immediately in the back room overlooking a psychedelic garden. Julie (who bears a striking resemblance to Scarlett Johansson) and Richard took excellent care of us, with professional and enthusiastic service. We accepted her recommendation to try the “special of the week), “sepas.” I’m still not certain what it was, but it had mushrooms and diced potatoes, shrouded in sauce, served piping hot in a cast iron skillet and dotted with crisp veggie chips. Between that and the Tuna Tataki (DELISH), we didn’t have room to finish the chicken! Accompanied by 2 copas of white wine (mine), and 3 copas of red (his), we were surprised to find the entire bill came to only 38 euros! OK, the wine glasses were small, but it’s just as well. My husband declared the meal the best of our 4 nights in Madrid. And Richard treated us to an after dinner sweet liqueur served in icy test tubes. Buenos!

review_preview: Refined interpretations of Spanish dishes. We showed up without reservations and were able to find room for two at the bar. This is a great location to see what is happening in the kitchen and watch the bartenders work.  These were the best mixed drinks...
review_full: Refined interpretations of Spanish dishes. We showed up without reservations and were able to find room for two at the bar. This is a great location to see what is happening in the kitchen and watch the bartenders work. These were the best mixed drinks we had on our trip. Food- the gazpacho is beautiful; try the croquettes - unlike many of the taverns, they make their own (rich flavor); the chicken dish made me wonder how they did it- simple, but delicious. Try the beef. If you have tried Vi Cool, InClan’s prices and the amount of food you receive are much better. We had tapas at Vi Cool and left for another trip over to InClan.

Arriving at 8.30pm,restaurant was half filled. The menu has many dishes that do half portions which was ideal to try a few things. Ordered prawns with garlic and grilled veg with goat cheese. Prawns came in sizzling oil with garlic and chillies. I have had prawns in much stronger garlic and seems that Spanish prawns are quite gritty even though intestines been removed. The grilled veg had aubergines, onions, sweet potato, green pepper, tomatoes and croguettes and the goat cheese was soooooooo good. It would be better if they put red pepper for some sweetness in the dish. Fantastic meal to finish my stay in Madrid

review_preview: We arrived at about 9pm and had to wait around 30 minutes for a table, which was fine, we waited in the bar area and had a drink.  As recommended by other reviewers we ordered 4 half portions for the two of us.  The Garlic...
review_full: We arrived at about 9pm and had to wait around 30 minutes for a table, which was fine, we waited in the bar area and had a drink. As recommended by other reviewers we ordered 4 half portions for the two of us.  The Garlic prawns had a amazing flavour and a pillowy texture. The cod with goats cheese and honey, served on a bed of potato was a delight. Grilled veg with goats cheese was a relief to finally eat some vegetables. The pulled steak cuban style was a kind of saucy curry, sweet and sour affair served with home made potato crisps. For dessert we shared milk cake. We were not sure what to expect. It was a sponge cake soaked in condensed milk, lovely. We were served by the very charming Carla, whose English was excellent. In fact everyone there was friendly and spoke English. All this plus a bottle of wine came to 36 Euros. This was the best meal I had in Madrid. I totally recommend it.

review_preview: we just arrived in Madrid and tried this restaurant after reading all the good recommendations here in tripadvisor. It was totally worth it!It looks like a typical Spanish taberna/tapas bar. The menu offers a few tapas but also a lot of various dishes such...
review_full: we just arrived in Madrid and tried this restaurant after reading all the good recommendations here in tripadvisor. It was totally worth it! It looks like a typical Spanish taberna/tapas bar. The menu offers a few tapas but also a lot of various dishes such as Latin ones (more Latin dishes than tapas). The main dishes can also be ordered as 1/2 portions if you want to try different dishes.  We have choosen several different dishes and shared them. I can totally recommend all of them! My favorite was the grilles squid with salad! (See pictures). The sangria was strong but very tasty. My boyfriend had "Alhambra" beer and really liked it. Tastes similar to Yuengling (the American beer, for those who are familiar with it). All in all we had a great evening with great food and very good service!  If you are in Madrid you should try this place!

He raved about it. I had the baby squid salad (half portion) which was great, but was really glad I only ordered a half portion. It seems to be a neighborhood type bar as the waiters knew many of the people and they knew each other. Prices were quite reasonable for the quality of food served!!

title_review: Excellent food, Brilliant service, Great atmosphere

review_full: I was in a party of of 12 English blokes on a stag weekend who ate here on Saturday night last week and I have to say we were blown away by the whole evening.  The menu was a little daunting at that time of day so we asked the excellent Oscar (from Ecuador) to sort us out with what he recommends. Every course was delicious, well presented and served in good time. And he in no way took advantage, the amount of food for us all was spot on. The thought of dealing with a fairly rowdy bunch may have daunted some, but Oscar was brilliant from start to finish. I even got a birthday cake!! The beautiful young lady working (Claudia?) was also very attentive and helpful throughout the night. I'd thoroughly recommend visiting here, whether in a big group or for a more personal meal.

We like to split our meals and they have an option for a half portion which is perfect for us cause we like to mix and match. We had a portobello mushrooms risotto which wasn't really a risotto if you ask me but was very tasty. I mean it was creamy yes but it wasn't from the rice but the mushroom sauce which was a bit too thick and the rice wasn't Al dente. We had a cesar's salad and again the sauce was a bit too strong for my liking. The curry chicken was great. And so was the lemon cake, very creamy and just enough tang. We got a complementary shots as we were leaving which made us stay for another drink. We went for cocktails and since I'm a big cocktail fan the cocktail master fixed me up with one of his recipes. And then another one so I tell him my opinion. We only got charged for one even though we had 3 cocktails. It's has great atmosphere, priced are acceptable and the waiters know their job. I'd go there again.

review_preview: Some one on trip advisor wrote that the ropa vieja here was the best food they had in madrid...that must have been after drinking four or five gallons of wine. Before I get to the ropa, let me flash back to the beginning. based upon...
review_full: Some one on trip advisor wrote that the ropa vieja here was the best food they had in madrid...that must have been after drinking four or five gallons of wine. Before I get to the ropa, let me flash back to the beginning. based upon the review about the ropa, my wife and I decided to try this place. we arrived and there were a lot of people already inside. all seemingly drinking and in high spirits. we walk in and were greeted warmly and taken to a table of two. the staff was great, polite and attentive. I loved them all. we ordered a bottle of wine which was delicious. no one rushed us. everything was great. my wife ordered what she thought was the Mediterranean salad, but maybe got confused and asked for the same salad the patron at the next table ordered. that salad looked fantastic. it turns out that the salad at the next table was not the Mediterranean salad, but the salad that had salmon. ok, it was still delicious. we also had the quiche with mushrooms. the flavor was very good, but I thought it was cold in the middle. the ends of the square piece of quiche that we got were warm or room temperature but the middle was decidedly cold, but who cares? we're on vacation, we have a bottle of wine to finish off. the vibe in the restaurant was hip and happening. all good. we order the ropa vieja and the risotto.  they brought out the ropa first. omg. the ropa was served on a plate with no rice, just chips, yes, freshly fried potato chips where some of the chips got stuck together and when you separate them, the part that stuck together is translucent...you know what I am talking about. thankfully, we ordered the risotto to go with the ropa. the risotto came out and it was inedible. I can only liken it to spackle. the consistency as unbelievable. I took a spoonful and turned it over and asked my wife how long she thought it would take to fall off the spoon. it took twelve seconds. the ropa, was brown and runny. the taste wasn't horrible, but the presentation was really sorry. after finishing our wine, we asked for the bill and paid and on our way out, the manager (I guess) shouted out not to leave, they wanted to give us a complimentary after dinner drink, which was soooo nice. (they had no idea we didn't like the food, we hadn't said anything.) like I said, I loved the staff, but the best food in madrid. errrr, there is a better place two doors down.  the fact that we found this other place while walking to taberna, made the evening worthwhile.

The wine menu is also quite different to the average place, I´d advise to ask the waiter for recommendation based on your taste. We went there with a vegetarian friend and for the first time in Spain she had a good selection of dishes to order. We went for the burrata, gazpacho, bravas, ceviche, pao and tortilla (probably the only disappointing dish even though it was recommended by the waiter). Next time I´m around I´ll definitely come back!

The appetizer could have been the meal itself. All parts of the meal were great portions and was quality food. Delicious and filling. I would 10/10 recommend. Even came back here 2 months later when I was passing through Madrid for one day and had a delicious entrocote. Staff is really nice too -- owner gave me a 10% off discount to come again! Can't wait to go back one day! :)

review_preview: Madrid must surely be one of the food capitals of the world.  Every dish at every restaurant we ate at in Madrid and Toledo had fantastic food.  However, I would rate this as the most "fun".This was where we first had a taste of...
review_full: Madrid must surely be one of the food capitals of the world. Every dish at every restaurant we ate at in Madrid and Toledo had fantastic food.  However, I would rate this as the most "fun". This was where we first had a taste of smoked octopus (see pic). It was served with mashed potato and a delicious sauce. As you will see from the photo, for people like us who had never eaten octopus, it was served quite spectacularly as a tentacle! With suckers... But it certainly lived up to its reviews! Wonderful flavour. We liked it so much, we had it again and again at other restaurants. This is also the only place where we had a ooo-aaahhh moment. Our order of hanging bacon or prosciutto arrived and was crisped up with a flaming torch (see photo) and served with green bread and pear puree. Also the only place where "Bao" was served. All delicious and the prices in Madrid are oustandingly good value.

Walk across the street and toward the Plaza del Sol, and find a nice local restaurant.

title_review: Come For The Raciones, Stay for the Cocktails
review_preview: We were recommended Inclan Brutal Bar by a family friend. And what a recommendation it was. The restaurant itself is trendy with a really chill, laid back vibe. They’re not afraid to experiment with their food, offering up their own take in traditional Spanish dishes....
review_full: We were recommended Inclan Brutal Bar by a family friend. And what a recommendation it was. The restaurant itself is trendy with a really chill, laid back vibe. They’re not afraid to experiment with their food, offering up their own take in traditional Spanish dishes. There was plenty of variety with lots of lovely meat dishes as well as really tasty salads too. The portions are really reasonably sized for the price you’re paying, most dishes were around €7-€9 (although I did think €11 for a salad was a little steep). Their cocktail menu is just as varied as their food menu again adding welcome changes to traditional cocktails such as mojitos. Service was quick, efficient and pleasant. It’s fairly centrally located with plenty of bars and clubs to choose from afterwards. I really enjoyed my meal here and was surprised my just how much I enjoyed the flavour combinations that they paired together. If you’re a looking to try something new or for somewhere laid back and fun, look no further. We will definitely be back.

title_review: Possibly the World's Largest Salt Mine
review_preview: This is my first review, and honestly I hope it will be my last.  They say you only review restaurants that you do not enjoy, and this is no exception.The Good:Server was friendly.Beer was cold.Wine was exceptional.The dishes were well...
review_full: This is my first review, and honestly I hope it will be my last. They say you only review restaurants that you do not enjoy, and this is no exception. The Good: Server was friendly. Beer was cold. Wine was exceptional. The dishes were well presented. The Bad: Along with some appetizers, we ordered the Paella Negra (black seafood paella with squid ink), which was the main reason we came here. We had had similar dishes elsewhere here in Madrid, and due to the hype of this place, we were excited to try it here. Boy were we disappointed. To say the dish was salty would be an understatement. You may argue that a seafood paella should taste like the ocean, however, as someone who tastes the ocean on a regular basis (I am an open water swimmer), this tasted like if you took the ocean, boiled off all the water, and then added salt. As I write this, my tongue is still burning, and I am slightly worried I may have injured my kidneys and had borderline heart failure. After taking two bites each, we sent it back to the kitchen. They apologized profusely, and promised to remake the dish with less salt. We debated if we should give them another chance, and decided it was worth a shot. The second dish they served us tasted like they had ran the original dish under some water, then added more salt. While we have no proof, we are fairly certain they tried to salvage at least some of the muscles/shrimp, as there was no noticeable reduction of salt on those items. To be fair, they checked up on us to make sure we were enjoying the second round. We regrettably informed them that no, it was still way too salty. Unfortunately, even after we expressed our distaste of their second attempt, they still charged us full price (we ate maybe 1/4 of if). Final Thoughts: If you are looking for a place to drink cold beer, delicious wine, and are a huge fan of salty food, this is the place for you. However, if you are looking for a good paella, move along…

review_preview: We visit Madrid every year for a weekend as we love the city and had done some research on Trip Advisor for places to eat. We booked online however decided that 8PM was a little early so stopped by on Saturday morning to change our...
review_full: We visit Madrid every year for a weekend as we love the city and had done some research on Trip Advisor for places to eat. We booked online however decided that 8PM was a little early so stopped by on Saturday morning to change our booking which was not a problem. The pictures online had put me off slightly however once I saw it for myself, I need not have worried. We arrived at about 845 and already it was very busy, unfortunately there was a hen party who got there at the same time and were very loud. We were seated next to them and upon seeing my face our charming and attentive waitress asked would we like a table near the front. This attention to detail was excellent as a table sat next to a hen party would have ruined our evening. The menu whilst fairly small seemed incredibly cheap, wine priced from 9 - 13 euro which I thought was a glass but was actually the bottle. Our waitress explained how the menu worked and we chose a number of dishes. It is Tapas but with a difference, we had the chicken, veal and tuna all which were to die for. The Albarino wine one of the best I have had. The service was super efficient and the place had a fab atmosphere. We travel a lot and eat out frequently, Brutal it is not!! Astonishing yes, and a bill of €35 unreal in a capital city. See you next time and thanks for a memorable evening

title_review: Most memorable meal in Madrid - an experience!
review_preview: Don't miss this place! Come hungry because their tasting menu is dish after dish of incredible La Mancha cuisine. Every dish crafted from family recipes with great care. What made the meal memorable was the warmth and hospitality of the hosts. They treated us like...
review_full: Don't miss this place! Come hungry because their tasting menu is dish after dish of incredible La Mancha cuisine. Every dish crafted from family recipes with great care. What made the meal memorable was the warmth and hospitality of the hosts. They treated us like family - even asking the men at the next table to translate the descriptions and history of the dishes. We had genuine hugs, encouragement, smiles and even a few pinches on the cheek throughout the night. It's a cozy, intimate restaurant with few tables so make a reservation. Oh, don't make the mistake we did and almost leave thinking it was closed. Luckily some Spanish men came by as we were leaving and knocked on the door. It appeared closed but if you knock you will be warmly greeted and served a memorable meal! The digestif liquors were as delicious and unique as the food.

review_preview: I'd put this on my list of restaurants to check out in Madrid after seeing rave reviews on the Spanish El Tenedor site. I knew from those reviews that the restaurant offered only a tasting menu (with some choices to suit your preferences), that the...
review_full: I'd put this on my list of restaurants to check out in Madrid after seeing rave reviews on the Spanish El Tenedor site. I knew from those reviews that the restaurant offered only a tasting menu (with some choices to suit your preferences), that the dishes were traditional (in some cases, based on historical reconstructions by the proprietess's uncle, Joaquín Racionero, a restaurateur, cookbook author, and poet), that the food was delicious, and that the owner was warm and charming. Well, it was all that and more. Normally, Milagros and Enrique operate by reservations. They nevertheless took me in on the late side of the afternoon, after I'd wandered past the door (the restaurant is on a tiny sidestreet and it looks boarded up or private: you have to use the traditional metal knocker to find out if anyone is "at home"). Since it was a slow afternoon and because they're immensely hospitable, they welcomed me wholeheartedly. The interior looks like a timeless "casa de comidas" in La Mancha (with its rustic feel, elevated by the beautiful tilework lining its lower half--from Talavera de la Reina?). The walls are plastered with clippings about MIlagros's polymath uncle, reviews of the counter-cultural effect of his reintroducing traditional Manchegan food to Spain's post-Franco early 80s, pictures of famous customers (they draw a distinguished clientele, despite the apparent simplicity of the decor and the very attractive prices), and even some very good art inspired by the warm welcome. Enrique and Milagros took turns serving dishes from the tasting menu, explaining each one with relish and solicitious care. I expected flavorful, but somewhat heavy dishes: nothing of the kind. Even the initial manchegan chorizo was smooth and light, as were the shepherd gazpacho (nothing to do with Andalusian gazpacho: a thin hash of hare, hen, quail, and pheasant) and the manchegan gazpacho (a Sephardic dish, with slices of unleavened bread that felt and tasted like pasta in a lovely, brothier version of the shepherd gazpacho). Next came a possible precursor to French pate (the meatier morteruelo, served warm with little square slices of toast), followed by yet another dish I'd never sampled (atascaburras)--a kind of puree of cod and potatoes, garnished with boiled egg and walnuts (which gave a satisfying crunch). I don't much like cod as a rule but really took to this combo. Milagros then offered a range of choices for the main course: I picked the quail in chocolate sauce, Milagros's own divine invention. We concluded with a sampler of desserts, all of Sephardic or Islamic inspiration: mostillo (grape juice/must, cinammon, nuts), alajú (think a softer, more flavorful turrón), arrope (candied pumpkin in a burnt honey sauce), and a heavenly slice of lightly fried eggplant drizzled with honey (I don't like eggplant but loved this). One dish more satisfying than the next (the mostillo pairs nicely with the cheese slices they offer). Even the open-pot coffee and the liqueur (a very mild, slightly coffee-flavored Cuencan home brew called resolí) were excellent. All served up with humor, with, warmth, tremendous vitality, and absolute integrity. The tasting menu is absolutely essential for this kind of food: well-sourced, highly elaborate, requiring many hours to cook properly and achieve the ideal lightness and complexity. They price this labor of love to attract repeat visits. They're so honorable, they tried to give me the 30% discount from El Tenedor that the other customers in the restaurant had arranged for on-line. I made up for their very Spanish gesture with the tip: this kind of integrity deserves support. I am left with the memory of Milagros pointing out a painting and note by a customer from Huelva (an artist named Rafa Pinto, with shows in Madrid), who chose to commemorate his visit, and celebrate their warmth and charm, with a striking work of art. A very special place, led by two vital, creative persons.

So after knocking on the door, we almost walked away until the owner opened the door and we found a very nice, homely restaurant. El Tormo doesn't have a menu but we had a tasting instead of very nice dishes (starters) from La Mancha. As we understand a bit of Spanish we understood what dishes we had (but if you don't speak any Spanish you may struggle). As a main we had haddock (my wife) and I had partridge. Very nice indeed and very friendly owners. Really special restaurant. Affordable too.

review_preview: El Tormo is a traditional spanish restaurant where you can taste different dishes from "La Mancha" region. Food is strong and very good for cold winter days. It may be something different for foreign people but if you want to know something about typical food...
review_full: El Tormo is a traditional spanish restaurant where you can taste different dishes from "La Mancha" region. Food is strong and very good for cold winter days. It may be something different for foreign people but if you want to know something about typical food related with "D. Quixote" home land, you have to try. It is a small cosy restaurant good for families or small groups of friends. Prices are on the average for a restaurant. Finally I have to say that it is located near The Royal Palace, which means Madrid city center.

review_full: We tried to go here for dinner but it was too crowded so we ended up coming back for lunch. It was awesome. Food was authentic, tasty and service was wonderful! If you want to go for dinner I suggest getting a reservation. This is a must try if in Madrid!! We ordered a few tapas to share and then also split the seafood paella. Enjoyed a bottle of Cava and some beers, which were tasty and cold! Best meal we have had thus far in Madrid! I cannot thank our waitress Ana enough for being so sweet, and her great recommendations! Miko was also extremely helpful and an ATL hawks fan, which we loved!

title_review: Excellent Service. However Ordered my steak a certain way, but happily ate it.
review_preview: It all began on that one fateful night in the capital of the Kingdom of Spain. We were searching for a burger establishment that had the best of both worlds; an A1A steakhouse meets rich Spanish culture. So at last we found a hidden gem...
review_full: It all began on that one fateful night in the capital of the Kingdom of Spain. We were searching for a burger establishment that had the best of both worlds; an A1A steakhouse meets rich Spanish culture. So at last we found a hidden gem in a realm full of rhinestones. We were pleasantly amazed with the inviting entrance of the exterior [10/10]. The interior was well collected, clean & gloriously organized [10/10]. In addition, the hostess extended a warm welcome and instantly found us a readily available table [10/10]. The server was proactively attentive and recommend us some A1A dishes [10/10]. No doubt, it was a little packed for dinner, but managed to fulfill amazing service [10/10]. On the other hand, I ordered my steak a certain way, and ended liking it even better than I originally expected it [20/10]. The bathrooms were sparklingly pristine with the familiar aroma of a freshly clean restroom [10/10]. To conclude, I will happily recommend this establishment to anyone looking forward to coming to Spain.

review_preview: We were visiting Madrid with some friends and the second day we went to Zenit for breakfast. We hadn't booked ahead and came around 09:30 and the place was already full. But they opened additional part of the restaurant at 10:00 so we were put...
review_full: We were visiting Madrid with some friends and the second day we went to Zenit for breakfast. We hadn't booked ahead and came around 09:30 and the place was already full. But they opened additional part of the restaurant at 10:00 so we were put on the waiting list and after 30 min got a table.  We all ordered different dished. I had a sandwich with fried eggs, avocado, bacon and tomato. And me and my wife shared a chocolate yogurt bowl with granola and strawberries. Both dishes we fantastic.  To conclude I was a bit hesitant if we were to wait 30 min for the table, but I'm so glad we did. This qualifies as on of the better breakfast experiences I had. This was a perfect way to start the day and prepare for exploring Madrid.

title_review: One of the best in Madrid
review_preview: One of the best dinning experiences in Spain. We were staying a few doors away and stumbled on to this GEM!  We tried several others in the area and kept going back to Mas Al Sur.  The food is truly top class and the staff...
review_full: One of the best dinning experiences in Spain. We were staying a few doors away and stumbled on to this GEM! We tried several others in the area and kept going back to Mas Al Sur.  The food is truly top class and the staff treat you like family. We do not speak Spanish (yet), but 'Have' explained the menu and the various options of plates, Tapas, Raciones or Media (half) Raciones. This introduced us into the world of Spanish cuisine which had been a little puzzling up until this point. My 16 y.o. son loved the deserts! The manager, Marcellas, was also extremely helpful and welcoming. These guys like their jobs which is reflected by their fun-filled approach but absolute professionalism!  Don't miss this warm, casual and friendly dining experience.

review_preview: Apart from having two service staff who were fluent in English, all staff members went out of their way to accommodate our big group of 6. Laid-back environment, suitable for family and friends.After explaining some of the menu items, giving recommendations and taking our...
review_full: Apart from having two service staff who were fluent in English, all staff members went out of their way to accommodate our big group of 6. Laid-back environment, suitable for family and friends. After explaining some of the menu items, giving recommendations and taking our orders, the food that arrived was absolutely delicious. The garlic prawns deserve a special mention, as does the beef tenderloin! Both were exceptional. The other food items were generally good, but the service was what made our night. The staff came over regularly to check in on us, shared a casual joke or two, and really made us feel welcomed.  After our mains, we ordered dessert and were treated to some shots prior to leaving. Wanting to commend their excellent service, we asked to speak to the manager, and was informed that they were all buddies and there was no manager present! So we decided to leave this review instead.  Please make a pit-stop at this wonderful place!

review_preview: This restaurant was one of the highlights of our trip!  It was recommended to us by our hotel and was perfect for our last night in town.  The staff here is fantastic!  Marcelo, Elena, Jesus, Carla, and Xavi were all amazing.  They were friendly, attentive,...
review_full: This restaurant was one of the highlights of our trip! It was recommended to us by our hotel and was perfect for our last night in town. The staff here is fantastic! Marcelo, Elena, Jesus, Carla, and Xavi were all amazing. They were friendly, attentive, and the service was quick. The menu is great and the best thing is that they had half portions (medio raciones) of the entrees available. This was perfect because it allowed us to try so many things! We loved the ropa vieja, solomillo + sur, parrillada de verduras, and the risotto were all excellent! The wine was good and a great price. This is a true tapas bar and is usually busy with locals at the bar. They had plenty of tables toward the back, we just had to ask at the bar for a table and were seated immediately. The end of the meal was perfectly topped off with a tasting cocktail from the bar that was refreshing and original and provided by the bartender as a thank you for our patronage.

Place: It's a hidden gem that I would definitely recommend people find in the heart of Madrid. title_review: Inclan: A culinary experience in the heart of Madrid
review_preview: We came across the bar while we were doing a 'tapas &cañas' tour. As a big fan of Valle-Inclán's "Luces de Bohemia", the bar inmediately catch my attention. Our hostess Valentina received our  group with a huge smile and immediately find us a very nice...
review_full: We came across the bar while we were doing a 'tapas &cañas' tour. As a big fan of Valle-Inclán's "Luces de Bohemia", the bar inmediately catch my attention. Our hostess Valentina received our group with a huge smile and immediately find us a very nice table. While waiting a couple of minutes for our drinks to arrive, we enjoy the wonderful decoration of the bar, modern, minimalist, full of life...there were eveb some pages of the author's oeuvre hanging from the wall. Yet the atmosphere was not the best thing about Inclán...the food is delicious, we were able to find even vegan options (something difficult to get when you are in Madrid surrounded by meat lovers!), the drinks were spectacular. I'd definitely recommend their 'rebujito', and the attention was top, all the waiters were kind, they are accoustumed to receive international costumers, so they do speak English and some of them French. I would definetely recommend this brutal bar :D

title_review: A great lunch with fresh food.
review_preview: I came here with the family of my wife. If I can complain about something it is the missing of an english menu. As italian I can almost get all the food in spanish but for the family of my wife it was difficult. Luckily...
review_full: I came here with the family of my wife. If I can complain about something it is the missing of an english menu. As italian I can almost get all the food in spanish but for the family of my wife it was difficult. Luckily we had Jordan, a great waiter, Jordan, who was really helful with all. I said about my allergy with garlic and onion and they manage to cook for me a real paella without these two ingredients. I know, it is almost blasphemy to take off these ingredients from most of the dishes but what can you do if you're allergic? Great empathy from the kitchen and, waiting 25 minutes, we had our special paella. The fish was super fresh and also the starters were really good. They offered us a taste of a liquor similar to baylies and we went back home happy and full. The price is a bit higher than other restaurants but it's fresh food and you can taste the difference. Thanks to Jordan for the great service.

review_preview: I went twice in the four days I spent in Madrid. The garlic shrimp *Gambones* will ruin anyone else's version and the cod with mushrooms, potatoes and cream *Bacalao con salsa boletus* is addictive. They're open for lunch as well as dinner. Food, service, ambiance...
review_full: I went twice in the four days I spent in Madrid. The garlic shrimp *Gambones* will ruin anyone else's version and the cod with mushrooms, potatoes and cream *Bacalao con salsa boletus* is addictive.  They're open for lunch as well as dinner. Food, service, ambiance (which includes lighting~dimmer switches are a great investment, Madrid restaurateurs) all get high marks. Generous portions, strong tasty cocktails, flavourful food, affordable and there are the nicest people working there. I wish I was there now. Just go!

Food was delicious, we almost ordered everything off the menu thinking that it was all tapas, the staff was kind enough to tell us it was way too much and made a bunch of great selections. The squid dish was so good that we ordered an extra one even tho we were stuffed! The risotto is a must try as well! As a pleasant surprise, the staff offered us all an alcohol shot on the house as we were leaving. They even toasted and drank with us! This was the only real meal we had in Madrid during our limited time there and it left such an wonderful experience! I'll definitely be back if I'm ever in the city again!

Unfortunately, I'm now back in New York City and I will be having Zenith withdrawals for a very long time LOL. Highly recommended!

title_review: best meal out i can ever remember - GET THIS RESTAURANT TO NO. 1
review_preview: I recently went to Madrid on a Art trip, where we indulged over selves with the amazing spanish culture. One night, a small group of us were wondering around looking around for somewhere to eat. As we stood in the street the friendly face of...
review_full: I recently went to Madrid on a Art trip, where we indulged over selves with the amazing spanish culture.  One night, a small group of us were wondering around looking around for somewhere to eat. As we stood in the street the friendly face of Johnny waved us in. Instantly we were immersed into an authentic Spanish restaurant. Bread and olives brought to table straight away. we ordered everything off the menu and shared it about. the flavours in my mouth were unexplainable. the squid, the garlic prawns, the risotto , just everything. I cant explain it. some of the best food I've ever had. now you may think, this sounds good but expensive. well youre wrong. all in all it cost us 12 euros each, including a cocktail each.  now the cocktails. this was another bonus. all amazing in flavour and also the appropriate strength. i recommend the long island ice tea. we came back the next night with the whole group of 37. and i was a bit nervy. as i bigged it up a lil. but it did not disappoint. if anything it exceeded my exceptions. and the chef was only 20. what a man !!! now Johnny. the nicest and most attentive waiter ever. he was amazing from start till end.  if you ever in madrid, stop by. even if it is for a drink. it will be worth it.

title_review: Authentic and high quality food to a fair price.
review_preview: An enjoyable small place in the local part of Madrid. I was popping buy after advise from Trip Advisor and was greeted by very friendly and service oriented staff that in perfect English advised me a good menu without over selling the dishes. I had...
review_full: An enjoyable small place in the local part of Madrid. I was popping buy after advise from Trip Advisor and was greeted by very friendly and service oriented staff that in perfect English advised me a good menu without over selling the dishes. I had the croquettes with Iberian ham served with small chips made from root vegetables a very delicious dish whit a fine note of mushrooms. Main dish was the Steak Tenderloin - very nice pice of meat perfectly grilled and with a really tasty Gorgonzola sauce. The potatoes under the meet was cold but the taste was okay and the bread was average. All in all a recommendable meal to a fair price in a slightly rough restaurant where you can relax without worrying about dress code or the table cloth.

review_preview: “Steakburger Gran Vía” is the place to be if you like a typical American burger. It’s located in the center of Madrid, next to the shopping-street Gran Vía. After a nice day of shopping, you can easily walk to the restaurant and enjoy a nice...
review_full: “Steakburger Gran Vía” is the place to be if you like a typical American burger. It’s located in the center of Madrid, next to the shopping-street Gran Vía. After a nice day of shopping, you can easily walk to the restaurant and enjoy a nice meal.  Inside, you get the feeling that you’re inside an American restaurant. It’s quite dark but it gave me a very cozy feeling. The furniture is a beautiful combination of vintage leather chairs and very modern black steel cupboards. I found it very comfortable that there is a lot of space between the tables. That way, you don’t have the feeling that you’re in a crowdy restaurant.  Two weeks ago, I ordered the crispy chickenburger with a delicious layer of cheese and fries. The fries weren’t deep-fried but they were baked in the oven which made them very crispy. I absolutely adored the fries! The chickenburger was served on a big plate. The chicken was fried and the bread was slightly toasted. It was very savoury. Another good thing about this burger is that it wasn’t overfilled. That way I could eat it without spilling too much.  The service in this restaurant was absolutely amazing. I came in and the waiters immediately greeted me. I ordered my food and I got it after 10-15 minutes. The staff was very friendly. When I left the restaurant, they asked me if I was happy with the service they gave me. They saw that I was a tourist and we made a chat about my time in Madrid. I have nothing to complain about concerning this restaurant.

review_preview: We were seated by the hostess and Peter greeted us at the table immediately and started our orders. After glancing at the menu, we knew what we were going to order. We got the Cuban shredded beef, a seafood paella, chicken curry, a pan fried...
review_full: We were seated by the hostess and Peter greeted us at the table immediately and started our orders. After glancing at the menu, we knew what we were going to order. We got the Cuban shredded beef, a seafood paella, chicken curry, a pan fried eggplant, and a salad. We also ordered a pitcher of sangria for the table. The sangria arrived first and it was by far our favorite sangria of the trip; and we literally drank at least 2 a day. We ordered another one for the table in the middle of the meal because it was so delicious. The salad arrived shortly after the first pitcher of sangria and it was alright. I mean, it's a salad. We made 2 separate "portions" as our table was a bit smaller for 5 people and the shredded beef and eggplant came out in the first batch. The amount of tenderness and moist complemented the crisp that the potato chips offered and it was my personal favorite for the meal and I wish it came out last, but it was definitely an appetizer type dish for everyone to share. The pan fried eggplants were seasoned perfectly and were a little crisp on the outside and tasteful on the inside. The paella and chicken curry arrived second. If you love seafood, this one is probably for you. You can probably get away with ordering two of these for the table because the size is smaller compared to the other paellas we ate around Madrid. It was very flavorful nonetheless and it came with a giant prawn, a few shrimp, clams, a squid, and calamari, and a squid. Peter, our waiter was very friendly and attentive the whole meal. He made casual conversation with us even gave us a few free treats like lemon liquor and a cheesecake. He was really fun and a delight to have. Definitely a recommend here, even if you come just for a drink and a snack.

review_preview: We discovered this place (thanks to TripAdvisor) after visiting Museo Reina Sofia. It was a few minutes walk from the museum. We had a short wait for a table around 3:45 pm. It's a small, cozy cafe with excellent service and food. Delicious bread was...
review_full: We discovered this place (thanks to TripAdvisor) after visiting Museo Reina Sofia. It was a few minutes walk from the museum. We had a short wait for a table around 3:45 pm. It's a small, cozy cafe with excellent service and food.  Delicious bread was served first. Then the mains arrived! My daughter raved about the ravioli which she said was truly delectable. She wished the serving were larger! I had the paella de marisco which was moist and tasty. And hubby had the excellent and tender solomillo with a cheese sauce. A jug of generous fruit-infused sangria rounded out the meal.  Our handsome waiter, Matias, couldn't have been more attentive, solicitous, helpful or pleasant. He gave each of us a glorious shot of Crema de Orujo, which tasted like Baileys Irish Cream.  Congratulations to the superb Morning Team at Mas Al Sur and thank you for feeding us so well and making us feel so welcome. Will definitely go back there on our next trip to Madrid.

review_preview: Arrived at our hotel in Madrid in late afternoon. We rested in our hotel room after a long flight from California, U.S.A. This burger joint is not too far away from our hotel, and we were not yet ready to pick a restaurant that serves...
review_full: Arrived at our hotel in Madrid in late afternoon. We rested in our hotel room after a long flight from California, U.S.A. This burger joint is not too far away from our hotel, and we were not yet ready to pick a restaurant that serves Spanish foods. We chose convenience over anything else and we crossed our fingers. Restaurant staff are helpful and courteous, these young people tried their best to explain their burgers in English for us so that we could order the kind of burgers we wanted. My wife and I chose the oxmeat because we never had this meat before, and we were not disappointed.  Table service was pretty good. The oxmeat was quite thick and was cooked as ordered. Meats and French fries potatoes were both delicious. I ordered a Spanish brand of beer and it was very good! It hit the right spot after a long international flight and on a warm evening in Madrid. The burgers were thick and big we could not finish them, so we brown bagged the other half of our respective burgers. There was one minor problem though but it was quickly rectified by the restaurant staff. There are two sizes for their beers, a medium size and a large size. I asked the waiter how big the large size was, long story short, they brought me BOTH the medium as well as the large glass of beer even though I told the waiter I wanted the medium size of beer. I am sure it was the language problem that led to this problem because my Spanish is worse than their English. As I previously mentioned, this was quickly rectified by the restaurant’s staff. Side note, I ended up picking the Large glass of their beer!
